messages.message:
Hey team, I was trying to build jenkins image (because i added a new python package in a PR), but it is failing while installing java (openjdk-8-jdk). I’m getting the following error:
```Step 9/60 : RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y openjdk-8-jdk     && update-alternatives --config java     && update-alternatives --config javac
 ---> Running in 6e95013158eb
Hit:1 http://security.debian.org/debian-security buster/updates InRelease
Hit:2 http://deb.debian.org/debian buster InRelease
Hit:3 http://deb.debian.org/debian buster-updates InRelease
Hit:4 https://packagecloud.io/github/git-lfs/debian buster InRelease
Reading package lists...
Reading package lists...
Building dependency tree...
Reading state information...
E: Unable to locate package openjdk-8-jdk
The command '/bin/sh -c apt-get update && apt-get install -y openjdk-8-jdk     && update-alternatives --config java     && update-alternatives --config javac' returned a non-zero code: 100
make: *** [build-docker] Error 100```
I did some debugging and found that we are using jenkins:lts (that uses debian 10), which doesn’t have repositories for openjdk-8… ( https://www.jenkins.io/blog/2021/02/08/docker-base-os-upgrade/ )

@sid do we need to revert to v2.254?

and avoid `:lts` tag.
As i am blocked on this, i am reverting the PR https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/18047 and updating the image to unblock myself. cc: @sid
@sid might be helpful if you put your name in your github profile, took us a while to figure out who is “slaiyer” :sweat_smile:
We actually shouldn’t be on jdk 8 anymore. I remember moving all our services to jdk11 over two years ago (?), might have just missed the jenkins image and it’s been around since o.O
testing with lts-jdk11 tag, using its preinstalled jdk
